intro: Gaultheria dialypetala, commonly known as the Andean wintergreen, is a species of shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many evergreen and deciduous shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dark berries that are edible. Gaultheria dialypetala is often found in moist, acidic soils in cloud forests and alpine environments.
